Histogram.Name: DMB_Format_Errors_Fract

Histogram.Name: DMB_input_fifo_full_Fract

Histogram.Title: Fraction of DMB Records with DMB-INPUT TIMEOUT State
Histogram.Name: DMB_input_timeout_Fract

Histogram.Title: DMB Records with L1A out of sync

Histogram.Title: Fraction of DMB Records with L1A out of sync
Histogram.Name: DMB_L1A_out_of_sync_Fract

Histogram.Descr: The occupancy histogram shows CSCs reporting data, regardless of whether data format was intact or broken. Chambers within one raw belong to one 360- ring of chamber. The rainbow pattern of color within one row is due to directionality of cosmic rays. %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% At LHC, all chambers within one row should have equal occupancy. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% One should check that there are no new empty cells (check for the list of currently disabled CSCs) and there are no hot CSCs.
Histogram.Title: Reporting CSCs
Histogram.Name: CSC_Reporting

Histogram.Descr: Histogram shows frequency of format errors per CSC record. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% CSCs reporting format errors in more than 1% of events should be flagged. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% Pay attention to the temperature scale (it changes from run to run and during a run according to the histogram content).
Histogram.Title: Fraction of CSC Records with Format Errors
Histogram.Name: CSC_Format_Errors_Fract

Histogram.Descr: Shows a frequency of FIFO-FULL condition on DMB inputs (“OR” of 7 FIFOs: 5 CFEBs, ALCT, TMB). %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% Appearance of entries in this histogram is very bad and would typically imply a loss of synchronization, even if FIFO-FULL condition clears away. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% To dig out which of the 7 boards is actually responsible for the trouble, one needs to refer the “FEB Status (Timeouts, FIFO, L1 pipe)” canvas for the offensive chamber (this canvas can be found in the DMB group)
Histogram.Title: Fraction of CSC with DMB-INPUT-FIFO FULL State
Histogram.Name: CSC_DMB_input_fifo_full_Fract

Histogram.Descr: Shows a frequency of a TIMEOUT condition on DMB inputs (“OR” start/stop timeouts for 5 CFEBs, ALCT, TMB). %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% Appearance of entries in this histogram is very bad and typically implies badly timed-in CSCs. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% To dig out which of the 7 boards is actually responsible for the trouble, one needs to refer the “FEB Status (Timeouts, FIFO, L1 pipe)” canvas for the offensive chamber (this canvas can be found in the DMB group)
Histogram.Title: Fraction of CSC with DMB-INPUT TIMEOUT State
Histogram.Name: CSC_DMB_input_timeout_Fract

Histogram.Descr: Histogram shows how often CSC events come without ALCT data.
Histogram.Title: Fraction of CSC records without ALCT data
Histogram.Name: CSC_wo_ALCT_Fract

Histogram.Title: Fraction of CSC records without CLCT data
Histogram.Name: CSC_wo_CLCT_Fract

Histogram.Descr: Histogram shows how often CSC events come without CFEB data.
Histogram.Title: Fraction of CSC records without CFEB data
Histogram.Name: CSC_wo_CFEB_Fract

Histogram.Descr: Histogram shows unpacking efficiency. %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% Gross problems at a scale of >10% inefficiency can be easily seen as deviations from the flat red color corresponding to 100% efficiency. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% Smaller scale problems can be chased using the EMU Test10 canvas.
Histogram.Title: Fraction of Unpacked CSCs
Histogram.Name: CSC_Unpacked_Fract

Histogram.Descr: Histogram shows occurrences when SCA cells were filled due to too-high rate of LCTs and/or LCT×L1A coincidences. %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% In conditions of cosmic ray runs, appearance of entries is indicative of hardware problems, or more specifically hot CFEBs. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% This typically happens due to a loose CFEB-TMB cable generating a flood of CLCT pre-triggers (CBEBs are the only board that are readout on coincidence between pre-CLCT and L1A).
Histogram.Title: Fraction of CSC Records with CFEB B-Words
Histogram.Name: CSC_Format_Warnings_Fract

Histogram.SetYLabels: 1='No Errors'|2='Any Error'|14='Unidentified buffer'|15='DDU Trailer bit error flag from hardware'|16='DDU Header Missing'|17='DDU Trailer Missing (overflow)'|18='DDU Trailer Missing (2 headers in a row)'|
Histogram.Title: Readout Buffer Errors
Histogram.Name: All_Readout_Errors

Histogram.Descr: Number of Events in DDU. %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% All DDUs should give exactly the same number of events.
Histogram.Title: DDUs in Readout
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_in_Readout

Histogram.Descr: L1A increment from event for each DDU. Ideally, if all events are being processed by the DQM then L1A increment from event to event must be 1. %BR% %BR% *Local DQM*: However, when the rate goes up, DAQ-DQM may not be able to keep up with the data and are designed to skip events. Occasional skips (L1A>1) will inevitably happen at low rates due to Poisson nature of cosmic ray rates. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% One may also want to flag runs with extremely non-uniform response DDUs. %BR% %BR% *Global DQM*: dL1A need not be 1 (in fact, it will be very large as Global DQM gets only a very small fraction of events, ~10 Hz to DQM from the eventual 100,000 Hz of L1 rate. %BR% %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% Under no circumstances, the incremental L1A can be zero (there should be no entries in the bottom row of bins of the bottom histogram).
Histogram.Title: L1A Increment
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_L1A_Increment

Histogram.Descr: This histogram shows errors identified by DDU firmware and reported in the DDU trailer. Ideally, all entries should be in the bottom row of bins “No Errors”. However, this is not likely what one would typically see. Note that some of the errors are rather benign (e.g. #13 DAQ FIFO Near Full), while others are certainly very bad and may even require re-synchronization. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% The “OR” of all particularly bad errors in collected in bit #16 “DDU Critical Error”.
Histogram.SetYLabels: 1='No Errors'|2='Any Error'|3='DMB or CFEB CRC error: 01'|4='DMB or CFEB L1A Match error: 02'|5='Fiber Connection changed: 03'|6='Sync Lost was detected by DDU: 04'|7='Two Single Bit-Vote Errors: 05'|8='TMB or ALCT CRC error: 06'|9='Timeout Error: 07'|10='Lost CSC End of Data occurred: 08'|11='Lost Control word in event: 09'|12='CSC Error detected: 10'|13='DDU Clock-DLL error: 11'|14='64-bit alignment error: 12'|15='DAQ FIFO Near Full: 13'|16='DDU Single Event Warning: 14'|17='DDU Single Event Error: 15'|18='DDU Critical Error: 16'|19='TMB/ALCT-DDU L1A Mismatch: 17'|20='TMB/ALCT Word Count Error: 18'|21='ALCT Error: 19'|22='TMB Error: 20'|23='S-Link Not Ready: 21'|24='S-Link Full Bit Present: 22'|25='DDU Input Detected error: 23'|26='One Single Bit-Vote Error: 24'|27='No Live Fibers: 25'|28='Data Stuck in FIFO: 26'|29='L1A-FIFO Full: 27'|30='Wrong First Word: 28'|31='CFEB Count Error occurred: 29'|32='No Good DMB CRC: 30'|33='DDU-CFEB L1 Number Mismatch occurred: 31'|34='CSC LCT/DAV Mismatch occurred: 32'|
Histogram.Title: DDU Trailer Status Errors
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Trailer_Errors

Histogram.SetYLabels: 1='No Errors'|2=' Any errors: 00'|3=' DDU Trailer Missing: 01'|4=' DDU Header Missing: 02'|5=' DDU CRC Error: 03'|6=' DDU Word Count Error: 04'|7=' DMB Trailer Missing: 05'|8=' DMB Header Missing: 06'|9=' ALCT Trailer Missing: 07'|10=' ALCT Header Missing: 08'|11=' ALCT Word Count Error: 09'|12='ALCT CRC Error: 10'|13='ALCT Trailer Bit Error: 11'|14='TMB Trailer Missing: 12'|15='TMB Header Missing: 13'|16='TMB Word Count Error: 14'|17='TMB CRC Error: 15'|18='CFEB Word Count Per Sample Error: 16'|19='CFEB Sample Count Error: 17'|20='CFEB CRC Error: 18'|21='DDU Event Size Limit Error: 19'|22='C-Words: 20'|23='ALCT DAV Error: 21'|24='TMB DAV Error: 22'|25='CFEB DAV Error: 23'|26='DMB Active Error: 24'|27='DCC Trailer Missing: 25'|28='DCC Header Missing: 26'|29='DMB DAV vs. DMB Active mismatch Error: 27'|30='Extra words between DDU Hdr and 1st DMB Hdr: 28'|
Histogram.Title: DDU Data Format Errors
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Format_Errors

Histogram.SetYLabels: 1='No Errors'|2='Any errors'|3='DCC Link is Not ready: 01'|4='GbE/SPY FIFO is Not Empty: 02'|5='GbE/SPY Path was Not Enabled: 03'|6='GbE/SPY FIFO is Full: 04'|7='Not Ready is set by DDU S-Link: 05'|8='Link Full (LFF) is set by DDU S-Link: 06'|9='DAQ Wait is set by DCC/S-Link: 07'|10='DDU Buffer Overflow caused by DAQ Wait: 08'|11='GbE/SPY Fiber Connection Error: 09'|12='GbE/SPY FIFO Always Empty: 10'|13='GbE/SPY Event skipped to prevent overflow: 11'|14='GbE/SPY FIFO Overflow occured: 12'|15='DDU S-Link Never Ready: 13'|16='Link Full (LFF) was asserted by S-Link: 14'|17='DAQWait was asserted by S-Link or DCC: 15'|18='DDU Output-Limited Buffer Overflow: 16'|
Histogram.Title: DDU Output Path Status
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Output_Path_Status

Histogram.Descr: Inputs receiving a handshake from DMB (the handshake is obligatory, regardless of whether DMB has any data to report). %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% The histogram should be absolutely flat for all DDUs and their enabled inputs. %BR% %ICON{"warning"}% Under no circumstances, DDU inputs within one DDU may have different number of entries.
Histogram.Title: DDU Live Inputs
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Live_Inputs

Histogram.Title: Average Number of DDU Live Inputs
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Average_Live_Inputs

Histogram.Descr: Inputs receiving DMB data. Is typically very uneven due to varying event rates from different chambers. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% Particularly bad cases of hot chamber (chambers reporting data too frequently) can be easily spotted here. However, Test08 is much more suited for this.
Histogram.Title: DDU Inputs with data (DAV)
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Inputs_with_Data

Histogram.Title: Average Number of DDU Inputs with Data (DAV)
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Average_Inputs_with_Data

Histogram.Descr: Inputs in ERROR State. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% Normally all entries should appear in the bottom raw.
Histogram.Title: DDU Inputs in ERROR State
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Inputs_Errors

Histogram.Descr: Inputs in WARNING State. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% Normally all entries should appear in the bottom raw. %BR% %ICON{"tip"}% This histogram can be ignored by a shifter.
Histogram.Title: DDU Inputs in WARNING State
Histogram.Name: All_DDUs_Inputs_Warnings
